API¶

EPA SWMM Interface¶

class urbansurge.swmm_model.SWMM(config_path)¶

add_timeseries_file(ts_name: str, ts_description: str, file_path: Path) → None¶

Add timeseries file to SWMM model.

Parameters:

  • ts_name – Name of time series. No spaces.

  • ts_description – Description of time series.

File_path:

Path to .dat time series file.

Returns:

None.

compute_area_from_depth(depth, link_id)¶

Computes the cross-sectional wetted area of the pipe from depth and diameter.

Parameters:

  • depth – Depth of flow.

  • link_id – ID of link.

Return area:

Cross-sectional area of water.

configure_model()¶

Configure the EPA SWMM model from the configuration file.

Returns:

No return.

static discretize_invert_elevations(h1, h2, n_segment)¶

Invert elevations for discretized nodes.

Parameters:

  • h1 – Invert elevation of point 1.

  • h2 – Invert elevation of point 2.

  • n_segment – Number of segments that the original link was discretized into.

Returns:

Invert elevations of discretized nodes.

discretize_link(link_id, n_segment)¶

Discretize link into N segments that preserve the original properties of the original link.

Parameters:

  • swmm – SWMM model object.

  • link_id – Link to discretize.

N_segment:

Number of segments to discretize link into.

static node_positions(s1, s2, n_segment, n_round=3)¶

Generate equally spaced coordinates between two points.

This function computes n_segment - 1 intermediate coordinates between two given points, s1 and s2, such that they divide the segment into n_segment equal parts.

Parameters¶

s1ndarray

A 1D NumPy array representing the coordinates of the starting point.

s2ndarray

A 1D NumPy array representing the coordinates of the ending point.

n_segmentint

The total number of segments to divide the line into.

n_roundint, optional

The number of decimal places to round the coordinates to (default is 3).

Returns¶

ndarray

A (n_segment-1, 2) NumPy array containing the intermediate coordinates.

Notes¶

  • The function assumes s1 and s2 are 2D points (i.e., have two elements).

  • The function does not include s1 and s2 in the returned array.

  • The segments are evenly spaced along the straight line connecting s1 and s2.

Examples¶

>>> import numpy as np
>>> s1 = np.array([6145.251, 8446.927])
>>> s2 = np.array([3709.497, 4905.028])
>>> node_positions(s1, s2, n_segment=5)
array([[5430.75 , 7591.962],
    [4716.248, 6737.005],
    [4001.747, 5882.038],
    [3287.246, 5027.071]])

Set a link’s geometry.

Parameters:

  • link_id – Link ID to edit.

  • geom – Four item list with values for “Geom1” through “Geom4”.

Prints success if verbose.

set_link_seepage(link_id, seepage_rate)¶

Set the link seepage rate. Roughly equivalent to hydraulic conductivity.

Parameters:

  • link_id – ID of link.

  • seepage_rate – Seepage rate in project units.

Returns:

Prints success if verbose.

unpack_series(series)¶

Unpacks SWMM output series into datetime and values.

upstream_distance(component_1, component_1_type, component_2, component_2_type)¶

Calculates the distance upstream from component 1 to component 2.

Parameters:

  • component_1 – ID of component 1.

  • component_2 – ID of component 2.

Returns:

Distance upstream from component 1 to component 2. Returns 0 if component_1 == component_2 and np.nan if component_1 is upstream of component 2.

Sensors¶

class urbansurge.sensors.Sensor(sensor_path, sensor_name, description, sensor_make, sensor_model)¶
check_if_sensor_exists(sensor_name)¶

Check if the sensor directory already exists.

Returns:

True if the sensor directory exists, False if not.

get_record(record_name)¶

Gets the record associated with the record name.

Return record_df:

DataFrame of record .csv file.

list_records()¶

List all data records associated with the sensor.

Return records:

List of record names.

metadata_entries = ['sensor_name', 'description', 'sensor_make', 'sensor_model']¶
read(voltage_channel, sampling_rate, duration, plot=False)¶
static sensor_directory_name(sensor_name)¶

Check if sensor name can form a valid directory name. - 20 or fewer characters. - Only contains letters, numbers, underscores, whitespace, and hyphens. Replace white spaces with underscores.

Parameters:

sensor_name – Name of sensor.

Return sensor_dir:

Sensor directory name.

urbansurge.sensors.list_sensors(sensor_path)¶

Lists available sensors from sensor directory.

Parameters:

sensor_path – Sensor directory containing all sensor sub-directories.

Returns:

None

urbansurge.sensors.load_sensor(sensor_path, sensor_name)¶

Loads an existing sensor based on the sensor name.

Parameters:

  • sensor_path – Path to top-level sensor directory.

  • sensor_name – Name of sensor to load.

Return sensor:

Loaded instance of sensor class.
